text:
In this video, we will
teach you how to download
custom content for Sims 4.

Custom content adds
player-generated objects
and character features into Sims 4.

To start, go to documents
on your computer,

then go to Electronic
Arts and choose Sims 4.

In this folder, there
should be another folder
labeled "Mods."

If a mods folder doesn't
appear, simply create one
with the same spelling and capitalization;
keep this window open.

Next, choose custom content
of your choice online.

For this video, we will
go to the popular website
The Sims Resource, where creators upload
their custom content for download.

Click on the object you
would like to download.

To download it, scroll
and click "Download."

When redirected, wait for the
timer to prepare the asset
and hit "Download" again.
Once the content is downloaded,

copy and paste it into the
mods folder of The Sims 4.

Open Sims 4, click the three
dots, and go to "Game Options."

Go to "Other" and check "Enable
Custom Content and Mods"
and "Script Mods."
Click "Apply Changes."
For the custom content to register,
the game will need to be restarted.
Exit the menu and close the game.

Relaunch Sims 4, and
a pop-up should appear

showing what custom content
and mods have been installed.
Hit play, and you'll now enjoy The Sims 4
with your new custom content.
If you go into build mode,
you'll see the custom content is available

to be dragged and dropped
into your Sim's home.

You can easily find which
items are custom content
by this wrench icon.
